it.emarolab.sit

Class SpatialSimplifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.emarolab.sit.SpatialSimplifier
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SITBase

    public class SpatialSimplifier
extends java.lang.Object
implements SITBase
    The class to manipulate the ontology to obtain the minimal set of spatial relation for SceneRepresentation.

    This class simplifies the ontology in order to query only the minimal set of relations that are needed by the SceneRepresentation.learn(String) method. It is also able to revert the simplification (by modifying the ontology) in order to query the spatial relations in a more human understandable way.
    The actual T-Box considers always human friendly spatial relations.

    File: it.emarolab.sit.SpatialSimplifier
    Licence: GNU GENERAL PUBLIC LICENSE. Version 3, 29 June 2007
    Author: Buoncompagni Luca (luca.buoncompagni@edu.unige.it)
    affiliation: EMAROLab, DIBRIS, University of Genoa.
    date: 05/06/17

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpatialSimplifier

        public SpatialSimplifier(java.util.Set<GeometricPrimitive> objects)
        It stores an internal representation of objects Descriptor to be added in the simplified ontology or in the human friendly representation.
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • populateMinimalRelationSet

        public void populateMinimalRelationSet()
        It manipulates the ontology, and so the getObjects() sets, in order to have only the minimal set of spatial relation. Note that this method does not call GeometricPrimitive.readSemantic(). In particular it:
        • 1: sets all individual disjointed,
        • 2: clears previous spatial relations applied to the given individuals,
        • 3: sets the primary (not inverse) relation to be synchronised,
        • 4: removes transitivity and symmetric property features.

      • populateHumanFriendlyRelationSet

        public void populateHumanFriendlyRelationSet()
        It manipulates the ontology, and so the getObjects() sets, in order to have all the spatial relation in am ore human friendly representation. Note that this method does not call GeometricPrimitive.readSemantic(), sor performances purposes, since you may what to do further manipulation. In particular it:
        • 1: resets transitive and symmetric properties,
        • 2: clear the object property description Semantic.SemanticAxioms. This will make OWLOOP reading all the spatial relations, not only the primary, but also the inverse.

      • getObjects

        public java.util.Set<GeometricPrimitive> getObjects()
        Returns the objects of the scene. Their spatial representation changes based on the last call of populateMinimalRelationSet() or populateHumanFriendlyRelationSet().
        Returns:
        the given object of the scene with minimal or human friendly set of spatial relation.

      • readObjectSemantics

        public void readObjectSemantics(boolean reason)
        Calls call GeometricPrimitive.readSemantic() for all the given objects.
        Parameters:
        reason - true if you want to call the reasoning task befoure to read.
